p: Limited studies and research regarding preparedness plans for the care of cancer patients during an infectious pandemic exist 9, 10. In this review, we aim specifically to address challenges associated with cancer care during the COVID‐19 pandemic. Recent literature 1, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14 has already extensively addressed the virology, diagnosis, and treatment of COVID‐19 and is beyond the scope of this paper 2, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16.
